Docs.summary: This class is used to communicate the results of a sync operation to the SyncManager.

remarks.para: This class is used to communicate the results of a sync operation to the SyncManager. Based on the values here the SyncManager will determine the disposition of the sync and whether or not a new sync operation needs to be scheduled in the future.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Create a "clean" SyncResult.

remarks.para: Create a "clean" SyncResult. If this is returned without any changes then the SyncManager will consider the sync to have completed successfully. The various fields can be set by the SyncAdapter in order to give the SyncManager more information as to the disposition of the sync.

The errors are classified into two broad categories: hard errors and soft errors. Soft errors are retried with exponential backoff. Hard errors are not retried (except when the hard error is for a ContentResolver#SYNC_EXTRAS_UPLOAD request, in which the request is retryed without the ContentResolver#SYNC_EXTRAS_UPLOAD extra set). The SyncManager checks the type of error by calling SyncResult#hasHardError() and SyncResult#hasSoftError(). If both are true then the SyncManager treats it as a hard error, not a soft error.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: This instance of a SyncResult is returned by the SyncAdapter in response to a sync request when a sync is already underway.

remarks.para: This instance of a SyncResult is returned by the SyncAdapter in response to a sync request when a sync is already underway. The SyncManager will reschedule the sync request to try again later.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Used to indicate that the SyncAdapter experienced a hard error due to an error it received from interacting with the storage layer.

remarks.para: Used to indicate that the SyncAdapter experienced a hard error due to an error it received from interacting with the storage layer. The SyncManager will record that the sync request failed and it will not reschedule the request.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

member this.DelayUntil : int64 with get, set

Docs.summary: Used to indicate to the SyncManager that future sync requests that match the request's Account and authority should be delayed until a time in seconds since Java epoch.

remarks.para: Used to indicate to the SyncManager that future sync requests that match the request's Account and authority should be delayed until a time in seconds since Java epoch.
For example, if you want to delay the next sync for at least 5 minutes, then:

By default, when a sync fails, the system retries later with an exponential back-off with the system default initial delay time, which always wins over #delayUntil -- i.e. if the system back-off time is larger than #delayUntil, #delayUntil will essentially be ignored.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HasHardError As Boolean
public: property bool HasHardError { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Convenience method for determining if the SyncResult indicates that a hard error occurred.
Docs.value: true if a hard error is indicated

remarks.para: Convenience method for determining if the SyncResult indicates that a hard error occurred. See #SyncResult() for an explanation of what the SyncManager does when it sees a hard error.

A hard error is indicated when any of the following is true: <ul> <li> SyncStats#numParseExceptions > 0 <li> SyncStats#numConflictDetectedExceptions > 0 <li> SyncStats#numAuthExceptions > 0 <li> #tooManyDeletions<li> #tooManyRetries<li> #databaseError
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HasSoftError As Boolean
public: property bool HasSoftError { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Convenience method for determining if the SyncResult indicates that a soft error occurred.
Docs.value: true if a soft error is indicated

remarks.para: Convenience method for determining if the SyncResult indicates that a soft error occurred. See #SyncResult() for an explanation of what the SyncManager does when it sees a soft error.

A soft error is indicated when any of the following is true:
  • SyncStats#numIoExceptions > 0
  • #syncAlreadyInProgress
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string ToDebugString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Generates a debugging string indicating the status.

remarks.para: Generates a debugging string indicating the status. The string consist of a sequence of code letter followed by the count. Code letters are f - fullSyncRequested, r - partialSyncUnavailable, X - hardError, e - numParseExceptions, c - numConflictDetectedExceptions, a - numAuthExceptions, D - tooManyDeletions, R - tooManyRetries, b - databaseError, x - softError, l - syncAlreadyInProgress, I - numIoExceptions
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool TooManyDeletions { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.TooManyDeletions : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Used to indicate that the SyncAdapter determined that it would need to issue too many delete operations to the server in order to satisfy the request (as defined by the SyncAdapter).

remarks.para: Used to indicate that the SyncAdapter determined that it would need to issue too many delete operations to the server in order to satisfy the request (as defined by the SyncAdapter). The SyncManager will record that the sync request failed and will cause a System Notification to be created asking the user what they want to do about this. It will give the user a chance to choose between (1) go ahead even with those deletes, (2) revert the deletes, or (3) take no action. If the user decides (1) or (2) the SyncManager will issue another sync request with either ContentResolver#SYNC_EXTRAS_OVERRIDE_TOO_MANY_DELETIONS or ContentResolver#SYNC_EXTRAS_DISCARD_LOCAL_DELETIONS set in the extras. It is then up to the SyncAdapter to decide how to honor that request.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool TooManyRetries { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.TooManyRetries : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Used to indicate that the SyncAdapter experienced a hard error due to trying the same operation too many times (as defined by the SyncAdapter).

remarks.para: Used to indicate that the SyncAdapter experienced a hard error due to trying the same operation too many times (as defined by the SyncAdapter). The SyncManager will record that the sync request failed and it will not reschedule the request.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
